Choose how SpeakThat handles multiple notifications:
üîÑ Interrupt - Stops current notification and reads new one immediately. Best for urgent notifications.
üìã Queue - Finishes current notification, then reads new ones in order. Nothing gets missed.
‚è≠Ô∏è Skip - Ignores new notifications while reading. Simple but you might miss important ones.
üß† Smart (Recommended) - Priority apps interrupt, others queue. Perfect balance of urgency and completeness.
Smart mode lets you choose which apps are urgent enough to interrupt (like calls, messages) while other apps wait their turn.
Customize how app names are spoken in notifications
Example: X app reads as Twitter

Choose how SpeakThat handles notifications while music/videos play:
üéµ Ignore - Speaks over your media. Simple but can be disruptive.
‚è∏Ô∏è Pause - Pauses media completely while speaking. Good for podcasts, but interrupts music flow.
üîâ Lower Audio (Recommended) - Temporarily reduces media volume so you can hear both. Most natural experience.
üîá Silence - Doesn\'t speak while media plays. Quiet but you might miss important notifications.
Lower Audio works like a car radio - it ducks the music down when speaking, then brings it back up. Perfect for music lovers who still want notifications.

Shake to Stop lets you instantly silence SpeakThat by shaking your device:
‚ú® Why it\'s helpful: ‚Ä¢ Stop embarrassing notifications in quiet places ‚Ä¢ Quick control when your hands are busy ‚Ä¢ Works even when screen is off ‚Ä¢ No fumbling for buttons
üéØ How it works: ‚Ä¢ Shake your device firmly (like a dice shake) ‚Ä¢ Current notification stops immediately ‚Ä¢ Queued notifications are cleared ‚Ä¢ New notifications work normally
‚öôÔ∏è Customization: ‚Ä¢ Adjust sensitivity for your preference ‚Ä¢ Test your shake strength with the meter ‚Ä¢ Works great for both gentle and vigorous shakers
This feature is especially loved by people who get notifications during meetings, movies, or while driving.
Skip notifications that are persistent (ongoing) or silent (no sound/vibration)

üí° Persistent notifications are ongoing (like music controls, navigation, etc.) and silent notifications have no sound/vibration. This option helps reduce notification spam from background services.
Ongoing notifications that don\'t auto-dismiss (music controls, navigation)
Notifications with no sound or vibration
Notifications with minimum or low priority level
Notifications from system apps (Android, Google services)

Wave to Stop lets you instantly silence SpeakThat by waving your hand in front of the device:
‚ú® Why it\'s helpful: ‚Ä¢ Perfect for users who can\'t shake their device ‚Ä¢ Great for phones on desks or mounts ‚Ä¢ Works with one hand ‚Ä¢ No physical device movement needed ‚Ä¢ Accessibility-friendly alternative to shake
üéØ How it works: ‚Ä¢ Wave your hand in front of the device (like a magic gesture) ‚Ä¢ Uses the proximity sensor to detect hand movement ‚Ä¢ Current notification stops immediately ‚Ä¢ Queued notifications are cleared ‚Ä¢ New notifications work normally
‚öôÔ∏è Customization: ‚Ä¢ Adjust sensitivity for your preference ‚Ä¢ Test your wave detection with the meter ‚Ä¢ Works great for different hand sizes and distances
This feature is especially useful for accessibility, desk users, and anyone who prefers gesture control over physical movement.

This is how your notifications will sound with these voice settings.
Welcome to SpeakThat! Stay connected without staring at your screen. Your phone will read notifications aloud so you can focus on what matters.
SpeakThat needs permission to read your notifications aloud. Everything stays on your device and you control what gets read.
Your privacy matters. You control exactly what gets read aloud. Shake your phone to stop any announcement instantly. Everything stays on your device.
Let\'s set up some basic privacy filters to get you started. SpeakThat features a powerful filtering system that allows you to choose what gets read and what doesn\'t.
Type the name of an app you want me to never read notifications from. Common examples include banking apps, medical apps, and dating apps.
Type words or phrases that you want me to never read notifications containing. Common examples include password, PIN, credit card, and medical terms.
SpeakThat is ready to help you stay connected while keeping your eyes free! You can add more filters anytime in the app settings.
